chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
n: nat
f: nat -> nat
k: nat

Goal:
(forall i j : nat, i < j < n -> f i < f j) -> {p : nat | p <= n /\ (forall i : nat, i < p -> f i < k) /\ (forall i : nat, p <= i < n -> k <= f i)}

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
sum_powers_binary_le_inv : forall q : nat, 0 < q -> forall r : nat, r = power q 2 -> forall (n : nat) (f e : nat -> nat) (m : nat), (forall i : nat, i < n -> f i < r) -> (forall i j : nat, i < j < n -> e i < e j) -> m ≲ ∑ n (fun i : nat => f i * power (e i) r) -> {k : nat & {g : nat -> nat & {h : nat -> nat | m = ∑ k (fun i : nat => g i * power (e (h i)) r) /\ k <= n /\ (forall i : nat, i < k -> g i <> 0 /\ g i ≲ f (h i)) /\ (forall i : nat, i < k -> h i < n) /\ (forall i j : nat, i < j < k -> h i < h j)}}}
binary_le_joins_inv : forall (m n : nat) (f : nat -> nat), m ≲ msum nat_join 0 n f -> {k : nat & {g : nat -> nat & {h : nat -> nat | m = msum nat_join 0 k g /\ k <= n /\ (forall i : nat, i < k -> g i <> 0 /\ g i ≲ f (h i)) /\ (forall i : nat, i < k -> h i < n) /\ (forall i j : nat, i < j < k -> h i < h j)}}}
sinc_injective : forall q : nat, 0 < q -> forall r : nat, r = power q 2 -> forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat), (forall i j : nat, i < j < n -> f i < f j) -> forall i j : nat, i < n -> j < n -> f i = f j -> i = j
binary_le_sum_powers_inv : forall q : nat, 0 < q -> forall r : nat, r = power q 2 -> forall (n : nat) (f e : nat -> nat) (m : nat), (forall i : nat, i < n -> f i < r) -> (forall i j : nat, i < j < n -> e i < e j) -> m ≲ ∑ n (fun i : nat => f i * power (e i) r) -> {g : nat -> nat | m = ∑ n (fun i : nat => g i * power (e i) r) /\ (forall i : nat, i < n -> g i ≲ f i)}
sum_powers_ortho : forall q : nat, 0 < q -> forall r : nat, r = power q 2 -> forall (n : nat) (f e : nat -> nat), (forall i : nat, i < n -> f i < r) -> (forall i j : nat, i < n -> j < n -> e i = e j -> i = j) -> ∑ n (fun i : nat => f i * power (e i) r) = msum nat_join 0 n (fun i : nat => f i * power (e i) r)
binary_le_joins_inv' : forall (m n : nat) (f : nat -> nat), m ≲ msum nat_join 0 n f -> {g : nat -> nat | m = msum nat_join 0 n g /\ (forall i : nat, i < n -> g i ≲ f i)}
msum_ext : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X) (n : nat) (f g : nat -> X), (forall i : nat, i < n -> f i = g i) -> msum m u n f = msum m u n g
Fin.to_nat_of_nat : forall h : ?p < ?n, Fin.to_nat (Fin.of_nat_lt h) = exist (fun i : nat => i < ?n) ?p h where ?p : [n : nat f : nat -> nat k : nat |- nat] ?n : [n : nat f : nat -> nat k : nat |- nat]
Fin.to_nat = fix to_nat (m : nat) (n : Fin.t m) {struct n} : {i : nat | i < m} := match n in (Fin.t n0) return {i : nat | i < n0} with | @Fin.F1 j => exist (fun i : nat => i < S j) 0 (Nat.lt_0_succ j) | @Fin.FS n0 p => let (i, P) := to_nat n0 p in exist (fun i0 : nat => i0 < S n0) (S i) (lt_n_S i n0 P) end : forall m : nat, Fin.t m -> {i : nat | i < m} Arguments Fin.to_nat {m}%nat_scope
binary_power_split : forall q : nat, 0 < q -> forall r : nat, r = power q 2 -> forall i a : nat, {u : nat & {v : nat | a = u ⇡ v * power i r /\ (forall k : nat, u ⇣ (k * power i r) = 0)}}
utils_nat.nat_sinc : forall (f : nat -> nat) (a b : nat), (forall x : nat, a <= x < b -> f x < f (S x)) -> forall x y : nat, a <= x < y /\ y <= b -> f x < f y
binary_le_power_inv : forall q : nat, 0 < q -> forall r : nat, r = power q 2 -> forall i a b : nat, a ≲ b * power i r -> {a' : nat | a = a' * power i r /\ a' ≲ b}
nat_meet_joins_distr_l : forall (m n : nat) (f : nat -> nat), m ⇣ msum nat_join 0 n f = msum nat_join 0 n (fun i : nat => m ⇣ f i)
bezout_rel_prime_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q /\ a <= q /\ b <= p}}
prime_or_div : forall p : nat, 2 <= p -> {q : nat | 2 <= q < p /\ divides q p} + {prime p}
Nat.lt_le_trans : forall n m p : nat, n < m -> m <= p -> n < p
Nat.le_lt_trans : forall n m p : nat, n <= m -> m < p -> n < p
FinFun.bFun = fun (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat) => forall x : nat, x < n -> f x < n : nat -> (nat -> nat) -> Prop Arguments FinFun.bFun _%nat_scope _%function_scope
is_lcm = fun p q r : nat => divides p r /\ divides q r /\ (forall k : nat, divides p k -> divides q k -> divides r k) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_lcm (_ _ _)%nat_scope
utils_nat.first_which : forall P : nat -> Prop, (forall n : nat, {P n} + {~ P n}) -> (exists x : nat, P x) -> {m : nat | P m /\ (forall x : nat, x < m -> ~ P x)}
bezout_generalized_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> {a : nat & {b : nat & {g : nat & {l : nat & {u : nat & {v : nat | a * p + b * q = g + l /\ is_gcd p q g /\ is_lcm p q l /\ p = u * g /\ q = v * g /\ a <= v /\ b <= u}}}}}}
utils_nat.bounded_search : forall (m : nat) (P : nat -> Type), (forall n : nat, n < m -> P n + (P n -> False)) -> {n : nat & ((n < m) * P n)%type} + {forall n : nat, n < m -> P n -> False}
div_by_p_lt : forall p n : nat, 2 <= p -> n <> 0 -> div n p < n
arem = fun n d q j : nat => j <= d /\ (n = 2 * q * d + j \/ q <> 0 /\ n = 2 * q * d - j) : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments arem (_ _ _ _)%nat_scope
prime_factor : forall n : nat, 2 <= n -> {p : nat | prime p /\ divides p n}
is_gcd = fun p q r : nat => divides r p /\ divides r q /\ (forall k : nat, divides k p -> divides k q -> divides k r) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
utils_nat.min_dec : forall P : nat -> Prop, (forall n : nat, {P n} + {~ P n}) -> (exists n : nat, P n) -> {m : nat | P m /\ (forall x : nat, P x -> m <= x)}
div_rem_uniq : forall p n1 r1 n2 r2 : nat, p <> 0 -> n1 * p + r1 = n2 * p + r2 -> r1 < p -> r2 < p -> n1 = n2 /\ r1 = r2
div_full : forall q p : nat, {n : nat & {r : nat | q = n * p + r /\ (p <> 0 -> r < p)}}
is_gcd_modulus : forall p q k r : nat, divides p k -> k <= q -> is_gcd p q r -> is_gcd p (q - k) r

```coq
intros H.
destruct H as [p [H1 [H2 H3]]].
exists p.
split.
- apply le_refl.
- split.
  + intros i Hi.
    apply H2.
    apply Hi.
  + intros i Hi.
    apply H3.
    apply Hi.
Qed.
```

original: intros H. destruct H as [p [H1 [H2 H3]]]. exists p. split. - apply le_refl. - split. + intros i Hi. apply H2. apply Hi. + intros i Hi. apply H3. apply Hi.
